thread.title: North Charleston City 6
thread.title_full: Candidates for North Charleston City Council, District 6 - Post and Courier

author: postandcourier.com
title: North Charleston City 6
text:
Dorothy King Williams Willie B. Heyward Age: 69
Residence: Dorchester Waylyn
Occupation: Attorney
Education: BA, Political Science, UCLA; JD, University California, Hastings College of Law (843) 568-4679; (843) 225-8754; williefordistrict6@live.com
 Internet surfing and reading
 I believe that my experience as a lawyer helps me to make decisions based on consideration of the various facets of issues and to consider both the impact and consequences of decisions.
 I want to be elected to the North Charleston City Council to represent Council District 6 because I to would like to assist and help empower the residents of District 6 to better their community.
Dorothy King Williams Age: 68
Residence: Liberty Park-Highland Terrace
Occupation: North Charleston City Councilwoman
Education: N.C. State, associate’s degree
Political experience: 24 years on City Council
Contact information: (843) 735-1539, dwilliams0521@yahoo.com
 Reading, listening to jazz, spending time with family
 Listening to my constituents and willing to work hard and fight for what’s right. Being available and a voice 24/7. Accomplishing whatever I set out to do.
 working with the school system in establishing a trade school for all high school students; supermarket for the Southern side of the city; piping ditches and speed humps in my district.
Jesse E. Williams Age: 35
Residence: Dorchester Waylyn
Occupation: Financial consultant and tax preparer
Education: Charleston Southern University, Master of Business Administration
 (843) 642-4233, jessefordistrict6@gmail.com
 Playing basketball, salsa dancing, and doing community outreach. I am passionate about the community and I believe in North Charleston. I was Dorchester Waylyn Neighborhood president, served on the Board of LAMC, and I am a business owner.
 to deal with the drainage issues in North Charleston’s District 6. This is a priority because sanitation and quality of life must be improved.
